item.title: Preparing for the New Semester
item.description:
ðŸ“Œ Week from July 23 to July 29

The vacation is reaching its midpoint, and I decided to do a bit of preparation for the upcoming semester. I made a list of subjects to be studied and found several online courses to deepen my knowledge in databases and analytics.

I also disassembled my laptop, cleaned the cooling system, and updated some software â€” now the equipment is ready for new workloads.

Little by little, I can feel the anticipation of returning to the university atmosphere.

item.title: Trip to Nature
item.description:
ðŸ“Œ Week from July 16 to July 22

This week was spent outdoors â€” my friends and I went out of town. Tents, a campfire, evening conversations, and a starry sky â€” exactly what was needed after an intense academic year.

During the day, we swam in the lake and went boating, and in the evening, we experimented with a bit of campfire cooking.

Trips like this help to reset and return to tasks with renewed energy.

item.title: Summer Projects and Self-Development
item.description:
ðŸ“Œ Week from July 9 to July 15

This week, I started working on a small project â€” a chatbot for automating simple tasks. Iâ€™m using Python and a library for message processing.

At the same time, Iâ€™m reading a book on algorithms that I didnâ€™t manage to fully cover during the semester. Itâ€™s fascinating to see how the theory studied at the university is now applied to real-world problems.

Even though the vacation is in full swing, I try to dedicate a couple of hours a day to studying and practice.

item.title: First Day of Vacation â€” Long-Awaited Rest
item.description:
ðŸ“Œ Week from July 2 to July 8

The exam session has finally ended, and the long-awaited summer vacation has begun. The very first thing I did was simply sleep in without an alarm.

I met up with friends in the park â€” we walked around and recalled the funniest moments of the past semester. The weather is perfect â€” itâ€™s the best time for walks and trips out of town.

Iâ€™ve planned a few small programming projects for July to stay in shape, but for now, Iâ€™m just enjoying my free time.
